value: — Capital of Mudug and home of the ex President of Somalia.

. The companies that operate weekly flights to
Somalia main Highway N° 1 passes through the city of
which links the northern with the southern parts of the country. There are also provincial roads that link Galkacyo with the towns such as
Every morning you can have a cup of cinnamon/cardomon tea with fresh goat milk.
.  Every day the camel caravans from the surrounding nomadic villages bring fresh camel milk. Refrigerated camel milk can remain fresh (dhay) for a week otherwise it becomes sour (caano garoor).
People in the region have learned how to harvest potable rain water, it is very pure and delicious. Different mineral waters from Mogadiscio, Puntland and UAE are also available.
At many local tea shops, stands and kioske one can find freshly squeezed juice drinks: mango, papaya, watermelon, ananas and the best one being spermuta from grapefruit.
Bottled soft drinks from the Coca Cola company in Mogadiscio are available.

located in the Arafat area. Rooms with en suite bathroom costs around $20 per person. The guest house has running water, electricity and connection with 3 different local telephone companies.  

Good food and it has the best cook in town who prepares delicious spaghetti, fresh fish, goat meat (suqaar) and variety of fresh fruits.
is located in the city center just 200m from the main market.  It is a new hotel which opened in August 2007. The Hotel has a big restaurant, a tea/Halwa shop and internet service.
is the biggest hotel in Southern Galkacyo, it has a big restaurant, shops and the a spacious confernce room.
is the newest Hotel which opened on April 2009. Has modern ameneties including a wireless internet service.    http://www.codkamudug.com/129409.htm
